titles.title: Cardfight!! Vanguard G
カードファイト!! ヴァンガードG
CARDFIGHT!! ヴァンガードG
卡片战斗先导者G

relatedanime.anime: Cardfight!! Vanguard G: Girs Crisis Hen

anime.description: A new generation of Cardfighting is about to begin. http://anidb.net/ch70498 [Shindou Chrono] is your average middle schooler. His looks make people afraid of him, but he has a kind heart and is loved by children. One day Chrono opens his locker and finds a Cardfight deck no one has ever heard of: Gear Chronicle. Chrono takes it to the nearby Card Capital 2 where he meets http://anidb.net/ch70500 [Katsuragi Kamui]. Kamui teaches Chrono how to play the game and opens the way for Chrono to gain new friends and rivals solely by having fun, including soon to be teammates http://anidb.net/ch70499 [Kiba Shion] and http://anidb.net/ch70497 [Anjou Tokoha]. Source: ANN Note: Set at Card Capital Shop No. 2 three years after http://anidb.net/a10483 [Legion Mate].

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

episode.title: 新導クロノ
Chrono Shindou
Shindou Chrono
episode.summary: It`s a new generation for Vanguard and at the head of the pack is Chrono Shindou, a misunderstood middle school student with a boring life until he finds a Vanguard deck in his cubbyhole one day. Chrono takes the deck to Card Capital 2, where part-time worker(!) and high school student Kamui shows him the ropes. But Kamui and the other customers are amazed because nobody has ever seen Chrono`s clan before. Enter: Gear Chronicle! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 葛木カムイ
Kamui Katsuragi
Katsuragi Kamui
episode.summary: Kamui introduces Chrono to the latest Vanguard tech, including a quest system that can improve a fighter`s grade. Kamui accompanies Chrono on his first quest, to help a kid find his lost Vanguard card, but they have rivals, the annoying and tricky but strong Team Trinity Dragon! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 綺場シオン
Shion Kiba
Kiba Shion
episode.summary: When Chrono takes on a quest that has him trying to coax his way into an elderly woman`s home, he`s upstaged by fellow Vanguard fighter Shion Kiba. This leads to a match between them at Card Capital 2, but will Chrono be able to take Kamui`s advice and "evolve" enough to beat this tough opponent? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伊吹コウジ
Kouji Ibuki
Ibuki Kouji
episode.summary: Chrono picks a random quest to fight someone and goes to meet them at the Vanguard Colosseum, which employs the latest technology to make Vanguard fights more realistic than ever before. But Chrono`s opponent turns out to be Kouji Ibuki, a cold-hearted pro who sees right through him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 安城トコハ
Tokoha Anjou
Anjou Tokoha
episode.summary: Everyone is talking about the mysterious Gear Chronicle deck, possessed by only one person... who is currently suffering from a major toothache, but rather than going to the dentist, Chrono heads to Card Capital to fight a classmate, a beginner who`s been coached by Tokoha, the girl destined to become Chrono`s rival! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 麗しのナギサ
Beautiful Nagisa
Uruwashi no Nagisa
episode.summary: Nagisa returns, three years older than the last time we saw her, but none the wiser as she demands to fight Kamui with the usual high stakes of marriage! When Kamui chooses flight over Cardfight, though, Nagisa puts a bounty (via quest) on his head and even convinces Chrono to help track down her man. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シオンの誇り
Shion`s Pride
Shion no Hokori
episode.summary: Shion wants revenge after losing to Chrono, but he`ll get his chance in an unexpected way: the Vanguard Quiz Tournament, an event that pits Vanguard Cardfighters against each other in games that test their knowledge, ingenuity, and fortitude! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 安城マモル
Mamoru Anjou
Anjou Mamoru
episode.summary: Chrono goes to the local Dragon Empire Branch for an event and registers for a chance to fight the Kagero clan leader, Mamoru Anjou... but he`s sidetracked by Vangarou, the Vanguard Association`s official mascot. Vangarou demands a fight with Chrono, currently the only known possessor of the mysterious Gear Chronicle deck, but the jolly-looking costumed character has a VIP inside! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハイメ・アルカラス
Jaime Alcaraz
Jaime Alcaraz
episode.summary: This week`s quest has Chrono meeting Jaime, a Spaniard who says he wants to see Japanese-style Vanguard firsthand, but then he drags Chrono all over town in a series of misadventures that may or may not have anything to do with Vanguard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トコハの宝箱
Tokoha`s Treasure Chest
Tokoha no Takarabako
episode.summary: When Tokoha was young, she and an older friend, Akane, buried a time capsule. Now Akane is going to move abroad and the time capsule has been unearthed. Will Vanguard be able to help these two old friends gain a sense of closure and open a path to the future? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSハイメ
Chrono vs Jaime
Chrono vs Jaime
episode.summary: Chrono finally takes on his friend, Jaime, the up-and-coming superstar from the Euro League. Will Chrono crack under pressure in his first serious fight? Or will he discover more about "the heat within"? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハイメのカード
Jaime`s Card
Jaime no Card
episode.summary: Chrono is inspired to become stronger when he watches Jaime and Mamoru fight at the interleague tournament. Later, he accompanies Jaime to an orphanage, and realizes he has more in common than he thought with his Spanish friend. But how far are they willing to go when Jaime is about to lose his most treasured card? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風来坊・タケル
Takeru the Wanderer
Fuuraibou Takeru
episode.summary: Chrono gets another mysterious new card from a stranger. He`s quickly forced to use it as a powerful new opponent challenges him to a fight! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カードキャピタルの夜
Night at Card Capital
Card Capital no Yoru
episode.summary: What starts out as a simple get-together at Card Capital 2 to celebrate Chrono`s move up to Grade 2 becomes an all-night party featuring ping pong, communal stew, and yes, Vanguard, too! Except Shin becomes a nervous wreck as the night goes on, since he`s trying to fly under Misaki`s radar... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うずまきキューピッド
Vortex Cupid
Uzumaki Cupid
episode.summary: Chrono, Tokoha, and Shion take on a quest to help a shy Cardfighter who fell in love at first sight with a girl he fought a match with once but never saw again. Can the quarrelsome trio use their resources and wits to track the girl down when they`ve got nothing to go on except a single card she left behind? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSトコハ
Chrono vs Tokoha
Chrono vs Tokoha
episode.summary: Tokoha feels down after everyone sees her only as "Mamoru`s little sister." Making matters worse, her favorite baked treat is constantly sold out. When she learns that Chrono has been beating her to the punch every day, Tokoha challenges him to a Vanguard match, with a bag of croquette bread on the line. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クランリーダー・マモル
Clan Leader Mamoru
Clan Leader Mamoru
episode.summary: The Dragon Empire Branch is holding a festival, and the already-overworked Mamoru has been put in charge, so he delegates a bit to his kid sister, Tokoha, who is tasked with coming up with a festival activity. Chrono is brought into the fold kicking and screaming, but comes up with a plan that may make the whole festival successful. Plus: Mamoru in three simultaneous Vanguard fights against our protagonists! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 仮面ゴースト
The Masked Ghost
Kamen Ghost
episode.summary: The Masked Ghost proves to be more than urban legend as he goes around town, stealing a precious card from every Vanguard fighter that he beats. Shion may know Ghost`s true identity, but is he strong enough to win back the stolen cards? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: メサイア
Messiah
Messiah
episode.summary: After the events of last episode, Shindou turns his back on Vanguard and Gear Chronicle, only to witness his nameless nemesis claim the unwanted deck. Is Shindou really ready to give it up for good? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偽りのファイト
Fake Fight
Itsuwari no Fight
episode.summary: Team "Still Undecided" participates in a mini-tournament so Chrono can earn the points he needs to go up to grade 3, the minimum requirement for participation in the upcoming regional tournament. However, when Chrono spots a team cheating at the tournament, he can`t help but get involved, a move that will have lasting repercussions for him and the team! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: まだない名前
Still Unnamed
Mada Nai Namae
episode.summary: The regional tournament is coming up, but the only way Chrono can participate is by forming a team of three people. Kamui steps in, signing up Chrono, Shion, and Tokoha together. The problem is, they don`t get along at all... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絆の力! エクスタイガー
The Power of Bonds! X-Tiger
Kizuna no Chikara! X-Tiger
episode.summary: Kamui lends Chrono a DVD, "Earth Defense Organization Caesar," which stars Team Caesar as a global defense force against invading giant monsters from space. What will lone wolf Chrono think of this team-centered story... and what does it have to do with Vanguard? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明日川タイヨウ
Taiyou Asukawa
Asukawa Taiyou
episode.summary: This episode serves as a perfect jumping-on point for real-life Vanguard fighters as Chrono shows a first-timer the ropes at Card Capital. Meanwhile, teammates Asuka and Shion drop by as they gear up for regionals! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チーム誕生
Birth of a Team
Team Tanjou
episode.summary: Chrono, Shion, and Tokoha participate in the "survival Vanguard" event, Chrono`s last chance to get to grade 3 in time for regionals. But he and the others have plenty of rivals on the mountain, not to mention planned obstacles and the pitfalls of a natural environment! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伊吹VSマモル
Ibuki Versus Mamoru
Ibuki vs Mamoru
episode.summary: Chrono continues his mad dash for points by completing as many quests as possible, but if he misses even one, he won`t have enough to make grade 3 by the entry deadline for the regional preliminary tournament. Meanwhile, Mamoru tries to help his little sister and her team behind the scenes... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダークな奴ら
The Dark Ones
Dark na Yatsura
episode.summary: Chrono is intent on getting to grade 3 before the big tournament, even though all of his points were recently taken from him. He finds a challenge with a jackpot payout that would take him back to grade 2 in one shot, but Chrono has no chance in the mysterious dark mansion if he goes it alone. And yet, he just quit his team... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 羽島リン
Rin Hashima
Hashima Rin
episode.summary: After Chrono`s win, their second match with Team Demise pits Tokoha against the nasty Rin Hashima, who has an old grudge against Mamoru. During the fight, Rin exploits Tokoha`s weakness, getting under her skin by calling her "Mamoru`s little sister." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チーム・ディマイズ
Team Demise
Team Demise
episode.summary: Team TRY3 has moved past the early rounds of the local tournament. Things start to get serious when Chrono goes up against Kariya of Demise, a team that has plenty of bad attitude and was specially-trained by the United Sanctuary branch. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風来坊, 再び
Again, the Wanderer
Fuuraibou, Futatabi
episode.summary: In the second round of the regional tournament, Chrono has a rematch with the wandering warrior, Takeru Baba! But Takeru has a lot of motivation for his travels, and when Chrono finds out what it is, it weakens his fighting skill! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 神崎ユウイチロウ
Yuichirou Kanzaki
Kanzaki Yuuichiro
episode.summary: The regional tournament is finally here and team TRY3 is as ready as it`ll ever be. But first, there`s an exhibition match between the winner of the previous national tournament and Kanzaki, the director of the United Sanctuary branch. What does this match between two titans portend for the future of Chrono and friends? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: メガラニカの人魚姫
Magallanica`s Mermaid Princess
Magallanica no Ningyo Hime
episode.summary: Chrono, Tokoha, and Shion get complimentary passes to Vanguard idol Saya Yatomi`s concert, but the TRY3 members end up with more than they bargain for, somehow getting dragged into working as security, wardrobe troubleshooters, and even becoming part of the show! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSシオン
Chrono vs. Shion
Chrono vs Shion
episode.summary: Chrono and Tokoha are still reeling from Shion`s sudden announcement that he`s quitting Vanguard. They do everything they can to persuade him to do otherwise, but Shion won`t budge. Chrono finally resorts to one last desperate gambit to keep TRY3 together. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 長い夏の始まり
Beginning of a Long Summer
Nagai Natsu no Hajimari
episode.summary: Tokoha and Shion are still in a funk over losing at the regional tournament, so Chrono forces them to go with him to the beach in a cheer-up effort. But when the weather doesn`t cooperate, the continued existence of TRY3 is up in the air... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 東雲ショウマ
Shouma Shinonome
Shinonome Shouma
episode.summary: Shion has the tie-breaking match between Team TRY3 and Team Demise, but it`s an uphill battle as his opponent seems to know everything about Shion, including the attacks he`s going to make. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡のカード
Miracle Card
Kiseki no Card
episode.summary: Chrono, Shion, and Tokoha all have the chance to fight United Sanctuary Branch Chief Kanzaki, the mastermind of the "brainwashing" system that churns out strong fighters. TRY3 wants to tear that system down, but they`ll have to beat Kanzaki first. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドッグトレーナー
Dog Catcher
Dog Trainer
episode.summary: The members of TRY3 infiltrate United Sanctuary Branch and split up. Chrono searches for the seemingly-brainwashed Taiyou. Shion battles his frenemy and United Sanctuary convert, Yuya. Meanwhile, Tokoha trails Rin of Team Demise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ユナイテッド・サンクチュアリ
United Sanctuary
United Sanctuary
episode.summary: Chrono, Tokoha, and Shion participate in the United Sanctuary Branch tournament, but something seems off from the get-go. That branch`s fighters seem too pumped up and when they lose, they`re dragged away by guards. Later, Chrono`s opponent in the final match turns out to be Taiyou, who`s changed a lot from the meek beginner he was when they first met. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新田シン
Shin Nitta
Nitta Shin
episode.summary: Shion is fired up about having another crack at Team Demise at an upcoming United Sanctuary tournament, but Chrono is shaken by his aunt`s revelation that his long-deceased father was a Vanguard fighter... and who apparently died because of it, so she forbids Chrono from ever playing again! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シオンVSショウマ
Shion Versus Shouma
Shion vs Shouma
episode.summary: The special fight continues with a match between Shion and Shouma Shinonome, who claims to be able to see people`s futures. Will his dark prophecy for Shion come true, or will our hero be able to carve out his own destiny? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トコハVSリン
Tokoha Versus Rin
Tokoha vs Rin
episode.summary: As the special United Sanctuary match begins, Tokoha gets the chance to redeem herself against the queen of Team Demise, Rin Hashima. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネクステージ
Nextage
Nextage
episode.summary: Team TRY3 is invited to United Sanctuary Branch for a special match, but will they be able to participate before the branch is suspended for its questionable training methods? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 日蝕
Solar Eclipse
Nisshoku
episode.summary: When Chrono and friends take Taiyou to an amusement park for a little fun and brainwash deprogramming, the head Dog Trainer shows up to take Taiyou back to United Sanctuary branch for more training. Chrono gets in the way and a (Card)fight ensues... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超越する力
The Power to Transcend
Chouetsu Suru Chikara
episode.summary: The grand conclusion to the fight between Chrono and Kanzaki! Will Chrono capture the hearts and minds of an audience of enemies? Or will Kanzaki get his miracle while proving that "weakness is a sin"? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVS神崎
Chrono Versus Kanzaki
Chrono vs Kanzaki
episode.summary: Chrono fights Branch Chief Kanzaki in a surprise match. If Chrono wins, Kanzaki has to admit the brutal United Sanctuary training system is wrong-headed and a mistake. But if Chrono loses, he has to give up his Gear Chronicle deck! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSタイヨウ
Chrono Versus Taiyou
Chrono vs Taiyou
episode.summary: Taiyou has gone through countless hours of training, all for the sake of defeating Chrono. Now is his chance as the two face off during the third fight of United Sanctuary`s special match. But Chrono`s goal is to get the old Taiyou back through an eye-opening battle! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ストライドフォース
Stride Force
Stride Force
episode.summary: When the special match is put on hold, Chrono and friends investigate deeper behind the scenes of United Sanctuary Branch and discover what Branch Chief Kanzaki is really up to! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVS伊吹
Chrono Versus Ibuki
Chrono vs Ibuki
episode.summary: In the aftermath of Branch Chief Kanzaki`s resignation, United Sanctuary Branch is under new management. Chrono agrees to meet with Ibuki to get some answers, but he won`t be satisfied until they fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決着
Conclusion
Kecchaku
episode.summary: In the final episode of the Vanguard G arc, Chrono`s fight with Ibuki finishes, but not before the Depend Card is activated. Later, more light is shed on the mystery surrounding Chrono`s father as well as a new, ambitious enemy... Source: crunchyroll
